thermography.detection package¶

class thermography.detection.EdgeDetector(input_image: numpy.ndarray, params: thermography.detection.edge_detection.EdgeDetectorParams = <thermography.detection.edge_detection.EdgeDetectorParams object>)[source]¶

Bases: object

detect()[source]¶

Detects the edges in the image passed to the constructor using the parameters passed to the constructor.

class thermography.detection.MotionDetector(scaling: float = 1.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class responsible for estimating the motion between two consecutive frames.

motion_estimate(frame: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶

Estimates the motion between the frame passed as parameter and the one stored in self.last_frame.

Parameters:frame – New frame of the sequence.
Returns:The estimation of the mean motion between self.last_frame and the frame passed as argument. The motion estimate is expressed in pixel units.

preprocess() → None[source]¶
class thermography.detection.SegmentClusterer(input_segments: numpy.ndarray, params: thermography.detection.segment_clustering.SegmentClustererParams = <thermography.detection.segment_clustering.SegmentClustererParams object>)[source]¶

Bases: object

clean_clusters(mean_angles, params: thermography.detection.segment_clustering.ClusterCleaningParams)[source]¶

Cleans the clusters by removing edges outliers (angle deviation from cluster mean is too high), and by merging almost collinear segments into a single segment.

Parameters:
  • mean_angles – List of mean angles computed for each cluster.
  • params – Parameters used to clean the clusters.
clean_clusters_angle(mean_angles: numpy.ndarray, max_angle_variation_mean: float)[source]¶

Removes all segments whose angle deviates more than the passed parameter from the mean cluster angle.

Parameters:
  • mean_angles – List of cluster means.
  • max_angle_variation_mean – Maximal angle variation to allow between the cluster segments and the associated mean angle.
cluster_segments()[source]¶

Clusters the input segments based on the parameters passed as argument. The features that can be used to cluster the segments are their mean coordinates, and their angle.

compute_cluster_mean() → tuple[source]¶

Computes the mean values (coordinates and angles) for each one of the identified clusters.

Returns:The mean angles, and mean coordinates of each cluster.
merge_collinear_segments(max_merging_angle: float, max_endpoint_distance: float)[source]¶

Merges all collinear segments belonging to the same cluster.

Parameters:
  • max_merging_angle – Maximal angle to allow between segments to be merged.
  • max_endpoint_distance – Maximal summed distance between segments endpoints and fitted line for merging segments.
class thermography.detection.SegmentClustererParams[source]¶

Bases: object

class thermography.detection.ClusterCleaningParams[source]¶

Bases: object

class thermography.detection.SegmentDetector(input_image: numpy.ndarray, params=<thermography.detection.segment_detection.SegmentDetectorParams object>)[source]¶

Bases: object

detect()[source]¶

Detects the segments in the input image using the parameters passed as argument. Furthermore the detected segments are extended on each side by a few pixels as defined in the parameters.

class thermography.detection.SegmentDetectorParams[source]¶

Bases: object

Cleans the clusters by removing edges outliers (angle deviation from cluster mean is too high), and by merging almost collinear segments into a single segment.

  • params – Parameters used to clean the clusters.
clean_clusters_angle(mean_angles: numpy.ndarray, max_angle_variation_mean: float)[source]¶

Removes all segments whose angle deviates more than the passed parameter from the mean cluster angle.

Parameters:
  • mean_angles – List of cluster means.
  • max_angle_variation_mean – Maximal angle variation to allow between the cluster segments and the associated mean angle.
cluster_segments()[source]¶

Clusters the input segments based on the parameters passed as argument. The features that can be used to cluster the segments are their mean coordinates, and their angle.

compute_cluster_mean() → tuple[source]¶

Computes the mean values (coordinates and angles) for each one of the identified clusters.

Returns:The mean angles, and mean coordinates of each cluster.

  • max_endpoint_distance – Maximal summed distance between segments endpoints and fitted line for merging segments.
